discourse_list.title: Whitelist light feed for rETH Oracle

content.content: The mainnet Medianizer for rETHUSD has been deployed and configured via spell: 0xF86360f0127f8A441Cfca332c75992D1C692b3D1 One of the light feeds listed in MIP10c17: Subproposal for List of Feeds is not lifted on the contract, reducing quorum. We’ve requested that the following light feed 0xa580BBCB1Cee2BCec4De2Ea870D20a12A964819e  be lifted in the upcoming governance spell. For reference:  MIP10c3-SP22 Proposal: rETH Oracle (Collateral Onboarding Oracle Assessment)

That lightfeed is marked as the Maker Foundation in MIP10. If it’s still a light feed, who is now in control of it? Conversely, if it’s now a darkfeed, it would be good to know that so it can be moved to the appropriate section. I’m guessing the ambiguity around that feed was how it was missed in the first place? More generally, that file hasn’t been updated in the last year or so. Assuming there is a more up to date version floating around in the OCU, can you guys provide it to the @MIP-Editors so they can update that list?

LongForWisdom:  More generally, that file hasn’t been updated in the last year or so. Assuming there is a more up to date version floating around in the OCU, can you guys provide it to the @MIP-Editors so they can update that list?   To LFW’s point, this would be great if we could link to the updated version in next week’s spell. Is that doable on your end @Oracles-Core-Unit ?

We can certainly update the list. The address was added via a governance vote just before the Multi-Collateral Dai launch prior to the MIP system existing. So finding the source for the specific governance poll is tricky (if you scroll back through time you will find it!). Currently the TechOps CU is stewarding the MakerDAO Light Feed as the TechOps team did within the Foundation.
Found the Governance Poll!  vote.makerdao.com   Governance Portal The MakerDAO Governance Portal allows for anyone to view governance proposals, and also allows for MKR holders to vote.

Thanks, I think at one point I was aware of the Foundation → TechOps thing, but it slipped my mind. More relevantly though, it would be great to have a system to ensure that the key oracle information remained public and up to date. I think the main elements we want to be public and up to date are:  The list of feeds (obviously without identifying information for the darkfeeds) The list of oracles we’re actively supporting and their status (I think some are on slowly update cycles to save gas? We should have this written up somewhere.) The list of whitelisted entities. The list and details of datamodels being used.  I assume these are all still meant to be public information? It is possible I’m just missing some docs or some dashboard somewhere, if they are up to date and public somewhere, a link would be appreciated. What would be ideal is not just getting updated docs, but implementing some sort of process via which they can stay up to date.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
